segment.source: Creating App-V 4.5 Databases Using SQL Scripting
segment.target: Creating App-V 4.5 Databases Using SQL Scripting

segment.source: Creating App-V 4.5 Databases Using SQL Scripting
segment.target: Creating App-V 4.5 Databases Using SQL Scripting

segment.source: Creating App-V 4.5 Databases Using SQL Scripting
segment.target: Creating App-V 4.5 Databases Using SQL Scripting

segment.source: Who is this solution intended for?
segment.target: Who is this solution intended for?

segment.source: Information technology professionals who manage Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 databases.
segment.target: Information technology professionals who manage Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 databases.

segment.source: How can this guide help you?
segment.target: How can this guide help you?

segment.source: This solution explains and documents the procedure to install the Microsoft Application Virtualization Server when the administrator installing does not have “sysadmin” privileges to the SQL Server.
segment.target: This solution explains and documents the procedure to install the Microsoft Application Virtualization Server when the administrator installing does not have “sysadmin” privileges to the SQL Server.

segment.source: Overview
segment.target: Overview

segment.source: One of the challenges of installing Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 (App-V) is that the install program assumes that the user installing the server features will not only be a local computer administrator, but also have SQL administrator privileges on the SQL server that will host the Data Store.
segment.target: One of the challenges of installing Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 (App-V) is that the install program assumes that the user installing the server features will not only be a local computer administrator, but also have SQL administrator privileges on the SQL server that will host the Data Store.

segment.source: This requirement is based on the fact that the database, as well as the appropriate roles and permissions, are created as part of the install.
segment.target: This requirement is based on the fact that the database, as well as the appropriate roles and permissions, are created as part of the install.

segment.source: However, in most enterprises, SQL servers are managed separately from the infrastructure team who will be installing App-V.
segment.target: However, in most enterprises, SQL servers are managed separately from the infrastructure team who will be installing App-V.

segment.source: These security requirements will make it difficult to get SQL administrators to give the infrastructure administrator installing App-V adequate rights; similarly, the SQL administrators will not have the required privileges to install the product for the infrastructure team.
segment.target: These security requirements will make it difficult to get SQL administrators to give the infrastructure administrator installing App-V adequate rights; similarly, the SQL administrators will not have the required privileges to install the product for the infrastructure team.

segment.source: Currently, an administrator attempting the installation of App-V must have SQL “sysadmin” privileges.
segment.target: Currently, an administrator attempting the installation of App-V must have SQL “sysadmin” privileges.

segment.source: In previous versions of the product the setup allowed for the SQL administrators to either create a temporary “sysadmin” account or be present during installation to provide credentials with “sysadmin” privileges.
segment.target: In previous versions of the product the setup allowed for the SQL administrators to either create a temporary “sysadmin” account or be present during installation to provide credentials with “sysadmin” privileges.

segment.source: In this release, scripts are provided in the released product for all administrators to use when implementing their infrastructure.
segment.target: In this release, scripts are provided in the released product for all administrators to use when implementing their infrastructure.

segment.source: This whitepaper discusses the scenario in which the install will need to be divided into two separate tasks: creating the SQL database, and installing the App-V server features.
segment.target: This whitepaper discusses the scenario in which the install will need to be divided into two separate tasks: creating the SQL database, and installing the App-V server features.

segment.source: The SQL administrators would be able to review the SQL scripts and make modifications to resolve any conflicts with other databases, or to support integration with other tools.
segment.target: The SQL administrators would be able to review the SQL scripts and make modifications to resolve any conflicts with other databases, or to support integration with other tools.

segment.source: The result of the scripts is to allow SQL administrators to prepare the database so that the infrastructure administrators do not have to be granted any advanced rights on the SQL server.
segment.target: The result of the scripts is to allow SQL administrators to prepare the database so that the infrastructure administrators do not have to be granted any advanced rights on the SQL server.

segment.source: This is important in environments where security policies would prohibit this.
segment.target: This is important in environments where security policies would prohibit this.

segment.source: SQL Database Creation Process
segment.target: SQL Database Creation Process

segment.source: The SQL scripts allow for SQL administrators to create the required database and also set up the privileges for the App-V administrators to successfully install and manage the environment.
segment.target: The SQL scripts allow for SQL administrators to create the required database and also set up the privileges for the App-V administrators to successfully install and manage the environment.

segment.source: The steps for completing these tasks are listed later in this document.
segment.target: The steps for completing these tasks are listed later in this document.

segment.source: This process separates the database creation and configuration actions from the actual App-V installation.
segment.target: This process separates the database creation and configuration actions from the actual App-V installation.

segment.source: Information to be provided to SQL administrators
segment.target: Information to be provided to SQL administrators

segment.source: Name of AD group that is going to be the App-V admin’s
segment.target: Name of AD group that is going to be the App-V admin’s

segment.source: Name of the server where App-V Management Server will be installed
segment.target: Name of the server where App-V Management Server will be installed

segment.source: Information to be returned to the Infrastructure administrators
segment.target: Information to be returned to the Infrastructure administrators

segment.source: Name of the database server or instance and the name of the App-V database
segment.target: Name of the database server or instance and the name of the App-V database

segment.source: Once the database has been prepared, the App-V administrators can run the App-V installation without SQL administrator privileges.
segment.target: Once the database has been prepared, the App-V administrators can run the App-V installation without SQL administrator privileges.

segment.source: Using the SQL Setup Scripts
segment.target: Using the SQL Setup Scripts

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: The following is a list of requirements for using the scripts which are located in the supportcreatedb folder at the root of the selected extract location.
segment.target: The following is a list of requirements for using the scripts which are located in the supportcreatedb folder at the root of the selected extract location.

segment.source: Scripts must be copied to a writeable location on the computer where they will be run (be sure to remove the read only attribute from these scripts after they have been copied) and SQL client tools must be loaded on that computer (osql is only required for running the sample batch files on the local computer).
segment.target: Scripts must be copied to a writeable location on the computer where they will be run (be sure to remove the read only attribute from these scripts after they have been copied) and SQL client tools must be loaded on that computer (osql is only required for running the sample batch files on the local computer).

segment.source: The SQL Server must support Windows Authentication.
segment.target: The SQL Server must support Windows Authentication.

segment.source: Ensure that the SQL Server Instance and SQL Agent Service are running.
segment.target: Ensure that the SQL Server Instance and SQL Agent Service are running.

segment.source: Log on with a domain account that is a SQL administrator (sysadmin) on the computer where the scripts will be done.
segment.target: Log on with a domain account that is a SQL administrator (sysadmin) on the computer where the scripts will be done.

segment.source: The scripts runs under the logged-on user’s domain credentials.
segment.target: The scripts runs under the logged-on user’s domain credentials.

segment.source: Database Creation Using SQL Scripts
segment.target: Database Creation Using SQL Scripts

segment.source: Tasks to be performed by SQL administrators:
segment.target: Tasks to be performed by SQL administrators:

segment.source: Copy the scripts contained in the supportcreatedb folder from the root of the selected extract location to the computer where the scripts will be run.
segment.target: Copy the scripts contained in the supportcreatedb folder from the root of the selected extract location to the computer where the scripts will be run.

segment.source: The following files are required for the scripts to run properly and must be called in the order presented below.
segment.target: The following files are required for the scripts to run properly and must be called in the order presented below.

segment.target: Example of how to automate the process using batch files

segment.source: If used, the two sample batch files provided run the SQL scripts in the following manner:
segment.target: If used, the two sample batch files provided run the SQL scripts in the following manner:

segment.target: Createschema.bat (1)

segment.target: database.sql

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Careful consideration when modifying the scripts must be taken and should only be done by someone with the appropriate knowledge.
segment.target: Careful consideration when modifying the scripts must be taken and should only be done by someone with the appropriate knowledge.

segment.source: Also, of the sample files presented only the following should be changed: createschema.bat, createtables.bat, database.sql, and roles.sql.
segment.target: Also, of the sample files presented only the following should be changed: createschema.bat, createtables.bat, database.sql, and roles.sql.

segment.source: All other files should not be modified in any way as this could cause the database to be created incorrectly, which will lead to the failure of App-V services to be installed.
segment.target: All other files should not be modified in any way as this could cause the database to be created incorrectly, which will lead to the failure of App-V services to be installed.

segment.source: The two sample batch files must be placed in the same directory where the rest of the SQL scripts were copied to on the computer.
segment.target: The two sample batch files must be placed in the same directory where the rest of the SQL scripts were copied to on the computer.

segment.source: Run the sample createschema.bat file to create the database.
segment.target: Run the sample createschema.bat file to create the database.

segment.source: This script will take several seconds to complete and should not be interrupted.
segment.target: This script will take several seconds to complete and should not be interrupted.

segment.source: Run the create schema.bat file from the directory where it was copied to.
segment.target: Run the create schema.bat file from the directory where it was copied to.

segment.source: Syntax is: “Createschema.bat ”
segment.target: Syntax is: “Createschema.bat ”

segment.source: AppV46SQLcreatebat
segment.target: AppV46SQLcreatebat

segment.source: If this script fails during the creation of the new “APPVIRTDB” database, check the log as indicated to correct the issue.
segment.target: If this script fails during the creation of the new “APPVIRTDB” database, check the log as indicated to correct the issue.

segment.source: It will be necessary to delete the database that was created with a partial running of the scripts in order to ensure that subsequent attempts will work properly.
segment.target: It will be necessary to delete the database that was created with a partial running of the scripts in order to ensure that subsequent attempts will work properly.

segment.source: Run the file to create the tables in the database.
segment.target: Run the file to create the tables in the database.

segment.source: This script will take several seconds to complete and should not be interrupted.
segment.target: This script will take several seconds to complete and should not be interrupted.

segment.source: Run the createtables.bat file from the directory where it was copied.
segment.target: Run the createtables.bat file from the directory where it was copied.

segment.source: Syntax is: “createtables.bat ”
segment.target: Syntax is: “createtables.bat ”

segment.source: app-v 4.6 sql createtable.bat
segment.target: app-v 4.6 sql createtable.bat

segment.source: If the script fails during the creation of the tables, check the log as indicated to correct the issue.
segment.target: If the script fails during the creation of the tables, check the log as indicated to correct the issue.

segment.source: It will be necessary to delete the database and run createschema.bat before attempting to run the createtables.bat file on all subsequent attempts.
segment.target: It will be necessary to delete the database and run createschema.bat before attempting to run the createtables.bat file on all subsequent attempts.

segment.source: Setting permissions on the App-V database
segment.target: Setting permissions on the App-V database

segment.source: The following accounts will need to be created on the SQL server with specific permissions and roles to the new database for the installation, deployment and ongoing administration of the App-V environment.
segment.target: The following accounts will need to be created on the SQL server with specific permissions and roles to the new database for the installation, deployment and ongoing administration of the App-V environment.

segment.source: Create a login for the App-V administrators group on the SQL Server and the APPVIRTDB database for the “domainApp-V Admins” (where “domain” and “App-V Admins” will be changed to reflect your own environment) and add them to the SFTAdmin and SFTEveryone database role.
segment.target: Create a login for the App-V administrators group on the SQL Server and the APPVIRTDB database for the “domainApp-V Admins” (where “domain” and “App-V Admins” will be changed to reflect your own environment) and add them to the SFTAdmin and SFTEveryone database role.

segment.source: app-v 4.6 sql script set permissions and roles
segment.target: app-v 4.6 sql script set permissions and roles

segment.source: Grant this group “VIEW ANY DEFINITION” permission at the global level (This allows the Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Server setup process to verify that the Management Server login already exists).
segment.target: Grant this group “VIEW ANY DEFINITION” permission at the global level (This allows the Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Server setup process to verify that the Management Server login already exists).

segment.source: Under MS-SQL 2005 and above access restrictions to the metadata contained in master.db were added.
segment.target: Under MS-SQL 2005 and above access restrictions to the metadata contained in master.db were added.

segment.source: The user created in the previous step will by default not have the rights needed by the server installation.
segment.target: The user created in the previous step will by default not have the rights needed by the server installation.

segment.source: Open the properties of the previously created login, Login Properties-Securables.
segment.target: Open the properties of the previously created login, Login Properties-Securables.

segment.source: Add the Database instance and enable “GRANT” for “View any definition” as shown in the screenshot below.
segment.target: Add the Database instance and enable “GRANT” for “View any definition” as shown in the screenshot below.

segment.source: app-v 4.6 sql script grant perm for view any def
segment.target: app-v 4.6 sql script grant perm for view any def

segment.source: Add a role to the ROLEASSIGNMENTS table for the login created in the previous step to allow App-V administrators access to the Application Virtualization Management Console, with role = “ADMIN” and groupref = “domainApp-V Admins” (where “domain” and “App-V Admins” will be changed to reflect your own environment).
segment.target: Add a role to the ROLEASSIGNMENTS table for the login created in the previous step to allow App-V administrators access to the Application Virtualization Management Console, with role = “ADMIN” and groupref = “domainApp-V Admins” (where “domain” and “App-V Admins” will be changed to reflect your own environment).

segment.source: app-v 4.6 sql script role assignment
segment.target: app-v 4.6 sql script role assignment

segment.source: Create login for SQL Server and App-V database for the Management Server.
segment.target: Create login for SQL Server and App-V database for the Management Server.

segment.source: This account is used by the Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Server to connect to the data store and is responsible for servicing client requests for streamed applications.
segment.target: This account is used by the Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Server to connect to the data store and is responsible for servicing client requests for streamed applications.

segment.source: There are two options, depending on where the SQL Server and Management Server are to be installed:
segment.target: There are two options, depending on where the SQL Server and Management Server are to be installed:

segment.source: If Management Server and SQL Server are going to be installed on the same computer, add a login for NT AUTHORITYNETWORK SERVICE and add it to the SFTUser and SFTEveryone database roles.
segment.target: If Management Server and SQL Server are going to be installed on the same computer, add a login for NT AUTHORITYNETWORK SERVICE and add it to the SFTUser and SFTEveryone database roles.

segment.source: If the Management Server and SQL Server are to be installed on different computers, add a login for “domainApp-V Server Name$” (where “App-V Server Name” is the name of the server where the App-V Management Server will be installed) and add it to the SFTUser and SFTEveryone database roles.
segment.target: If the Management Server and SQL Server are to be installed on different computers, add a login for “domainApp-V Server Name$” (where “App-V Server Name” is the name of the server where the App-V Management Server will be installed) and add it to the SFTUser and SFTEveryone database roles.

segment.source: Open the query window on the SQL window and run the following SQL:
segment.target: Open the query window on the SQL window and run the following SQL:

segment.source: Where the APPVIRTDB is the name of the App-V Database created on the SQL Server in the previous step, and the user who is going to do the install of the App-v server needs to be a member of “domainApp-V Admins” (where “domain” and “App-V Admins” will be changed to reflect your own environment).
segment.target: Where the APPVIRTDB is the name of the App-V Database created on the SQL Server in the previous step, and the user who is going to do the install of the App-v server needs to be a member of “domainApp-V Admins” (where “domain” and “App-V Admins” will be changed to reflect your own environment).

segment.source: Tasks to be performed by the Infrastructure administrators
segment.target: Tasks to be performed by the Infrastructure administrators

segment.source: Administrator in the “App-V Admins” group should install App-V.
segment.target: Administrator in the “App-V Admins” group should install App-V.

segment.source: Use information from the SQL administrators for selecting the SQL Server and database created in the previous steps.
segment.target: Use information from the SQL administrators for selecting the SQL Server and database created in the previous steps.

segment.source: Administrator in the “App-V Admins” group logs in to Application Virtualization Management Console and deletes the following objects from the Management Console.
segment.target: Administrator in the “App-V Admins” group logs in to Application Virtualization Management Console and deletes the following objects from the Management Console.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: This is required as the traditional setup populates certain records in the database that are not populated if you run the install against an already existing database.
segment.target: This is required as the traditional setup populates certain records in the database that are not populated if you run the install against an already existing database.

segment.source: Delete the following objects:
segment.target: Delete the following objects:

segment.source: Under “Server Groups,” “Default Server Group,” delete “Application Virtualization Management Server”
segment.target: Under “Server Groups,” “Default Server Group,” delete “Application Virtualization Management Server”

segment.source: Under “Server Groups,” delete “Default Server Group”
segment.target: Under “Server Groups,” delete “Default Server Group”

segment.source: Under “Provider Policies,” delete “Default Provider”
segment.target: Under “Provider Policies,” delete “Default Provider”

segment.source: Administrator in the App-V admins group should then create:
segment.target: Administrator in the App-V admins group should then create:

segment.source: Under “Provider Policies,” create a New Provider Policy
segment.target: Under “Provider Policies,” create a New Provider Policy

segment.source: Create a “Default Server Group”
segment.target: Create a “Default Server Group”

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You must create a “Default Server” group even if you will not be used.
segment.target: You must create a “Default Server” group even if you will not be used.

segment.source: The server installer only looks for the "Default Server Group" when trying to add the server.
segment.target: The server installer only looks for the "Default Server Group" when trying to add the server.

segment.source: If there is no "Default Server Group" then the installation will fail.
segment.target: If there is no "Default Server Group" then the installation will fail.

segment.source: If you plan on using server groups other than the default that is fine, it’s just necessary to retain the "Default Server Group" if you plan on adding subsequent App-V Management Servers to your infrastructure.
segment.target: If you plan on using server groups other than the default that is fine, it’s just necessary to retain the "Default Server Group" if you plan on adding subsequent App-V Management Servers to your infrastructure.

segment.source: Assign the App-V Users Group to the New Provider Policy created above
segment.target: Assign the App-V Users Group to the New Provider Policy created above

segment.source: Under “Server Groups,” create a New Server Group, specifying the New Provider Policy
segment.target: Under “Server Groups,” create a New Server Group, specifying the New Provider Policy

segment.source: Under the New Server group, create a New Application Virtualization Management Server
segment.target: Under the New Server group, create a New Application Virtualization Management Server

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Do not restart the service before completing all of the above steps!
segment.target: Do not restart the service before completing all of the above steps!

segment.source: Administrator restarts the Application Virtualization Management Server service.
segment.target: Administrator restarts the Application Virtualization Management Server service.

segment.source: Conclusion
segment.target: Conclusion

segment.source: In conclusion, the information in this document allows an administrator to work with the SQL administrators to develop a deployment path that works for the security and administrative divisions in an organization.
segment.target: In conclusion, the information in this document allows an administrator to work with the SQL administrators to develop a deployment path that works for the security and administrative divisions in an organization.

segment.source: After reading this document and testing the tasks documented, an administrator should be ready to implement their App-V infrastructure in this type of environment.
segment.target: After reading this document and testing the tasks documented, an administrator should be ready to implement their App-V infrastructure in this type of environment.
